meanings.definition: To gather into wrinkles or folds
meanings.sent1: She rucked up the blanket before sitting down.
meanings.sent2: The wind rucked the paper in her hand.
meanings.sent3: The mischievous puppy rucked the rug while playing.
meanings.sent4: Time rucked the once smooth fabric of the old flag.
meanings.sent5: The artist carefully rucked the canvas to create a textured effect.

meanings.definition: To engage in a physical altercation
meanings.sent1: The kids rucked over the last piece of candy.
meanings.sent2: The two players rucked fiercely on the field.
meanings.sent3: The siblings playfully rucked over the TV remote.
meanings.sent4: The street erupted in chaos as rival groups rucked.
meanings.sent5: The neighbors rucked in a friendly game of tug-of-war.

meanings.definition: To form rucks in a rugby game
meanings.sent1: The players rucked to gain possession of the ball.
meanings.sent2: The team strategically rucked to advance down the field.
meanings.sent3: The coach emphasized the importance of effective rucking.
meanings.sent4: The opposing team struggled to break through the strong rucking defense.
meanings.sent5: The crowd cheered as the team executed a flawless ruck.
